item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 8LP outside house number 240, 23rd June
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 8LP outside house number 240 “Rosendale Road” street name board (next to Dalkeith Rd junction) – plastic vinyl type with a four letter ‘word’ on it. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/place/240+Rosendale+Rd,+Norwood,+London+SE21+8LP/@51.4447936,-0.0979378,3a,60y,113.77h,66.39t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1s3xZy95mRwkwEENcet8d-MQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D23.60507099926342%26panoid%3D3xZy95mRwkwEENcet8d-MQ%26yaw%3D113.77386720848395!7i16384!8i8192!4m6!3m5!1s0x4876040910a81c3d:0x2ae0948949a90e0c!8m2!3d51.4447001!4d-0.097677!16s%2Fg%2F11c4rq4qzr?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDYxNy4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rosendale Road, Tulse Hill, London

item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 23rd June
item.description:
Dear sir/ma To whom it may concern Am a resident of Bertrand way, Thamesmead SE28 8LL, Am here to report an incident that has being ongoing in my area since over 12 months. There has been a lot of rubbish dump in my area, making the place a big risk of sickness and diseases to us and our children. I am pleading with the authority to help us to remove this as soon as possible and if possible place a restriction there to deter future occurrences!!! Attached it the picture of the dump. Kind regards Emmy
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bertrand Way, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole flat flytipped, 23rd June
item.description:
Over the weekend someone dumped a huge amount of what looked to be tenants’ possessions following an eviction. The waste team came and collected it. Today there’s a whole new collection of stuff including a fridge and foam furniture. This is very dispiriting for those of us who pay to have their bulky items collected properly, especially when it looks like it’s being done systematically by a landlord who’s chosen to save themself a few quid while blocking legitimate bin use

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marchwood Close, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bush growing near tree obstructs view of highway, 23rd June
item.description:
This bush is growing on council-maintained land outside 282 Bexley Lane, adjacent to a traffic sign and directly the line of sight of mine and my neighbours driveways as we approach Bexley Lane. As shown in the attached photo, the bush significantly obstructs visibility of the road when I am reversing out of my driveway, creating a clear road safety hazard. The obstruction makes it difficult to see oncoming vehicles, cyclists, or pedestrians, particularly from the oncoming traffic. Given the curve in the road and the presence of a warning sign for a bend, the lack of visibility increases the risk of an accident. Under Section 154 of the Highways Act 1980, the Council has a duty to ensure that vegetation on land adjacent to the highway does not pose a danger or obstruction to road users. This includes ensuring that visibility for vehicles is not impeded. I request that the council urgently trim or remove the overgrown vegetation to restore safe sight lines for drivers using this junction. Please confirm when this work will be carried out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 219, Bexley Lane, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
